<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>MASTER RECEIVABLES PURCHASE AGREEMENT</B> (as amended, supplemented or otherwise modified
from time to time, this &#147;<B><I>Agreement</I></B>&#148;) dated as of April&nbsp;21, 2017 by and between PNC Bank, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP>, as purchaser (&#147;<B><I>Bank</I></B>&#148;), and ZT
GROUP INT&#146;L, INC. (the &#147;<B><I>Seller</I></B>&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">RECITALS </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Bank may, in its sole discretion and on an uncommitted basis, acquire Receivables from Seller from time to time in an aggregate outstanding
principal amount not to exceed at any time the amount set forth as the &#147;Maximum Facility Amount&#148; on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other amount as may be agreed among the parties hereto by executing a letter in the form of
<U>Exhibit A</U> attached hereto, the &#147;<B><I>Maximum Facility Amount</I></B>&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The parties hereto intend that each such
purchase of a Receivable shall be governed by the terms and conditions set forth herein and, with respect to the particulars of a specific transaction, in a fully executed purchase notice substantially in the form attached as <U>Exhibit A</U> hereto
(each such purchase notice, a &#147;<B><I>Purchase Notice</I></B>&#148;) if such Purchase Notice is accepted by Bank as set forth herein. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B>, in consideration of the foregoing and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is
hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>SECTION 1. <U>Definitions</U>. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) <U>Defined Terms</U>. As used in this Agreement, the following terms have the meanings specified below: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>2021 Assignment and Agreement</I></B>&#148;: that certain Assignment and Agreements Regarding Master Receivables Purchase
Agreement dated as of September&nbsp;16, 2021 among BBVA USA f/k/a Compass Bank, as the &#147;Assignor&#148; thereunder, PNC Bank, National Association, as the &#147;Assignee&#148; thereunder, and ZT Group Int&#146;l, Inc., as the &#147;Seller&#148;
thereunder. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Agreed Currency</I></B>&#148;: Dollars and such other currencies as are set forth on <U>Annex A</U> attached
hereto (or otherwise mutually agreed upon in writing by Bank and Seller). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Agreement</I></B>&#148;: as defined in the
introductory paragraph hereof. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Applicable Jurisdiction</I></B>&#148;: with respect to Seller, the jurisdiction of
organization of Seller, the jurisdiction(s) of its place of business (or chief executive office if it has more than one place of business) and the jurisdiction of the governing law of the Contract; and with respect to an Obligor, the jurisdiction of
organization of such Obligor, the jurisdiction(s) of its place of business (or chief executive office if it has more than one place of business) and/or the jurisdiction of the governing law of the Contract. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Applicable Obligor</I></B>&#148;: with respect to any Purchased Receivable, the Obligor of such Purchased Receivable. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Applicable Obligor Limit</I></B>&#148;: the maximum permitted aggregate outstanding Invoice Amount of the Purchased Receivables
with respect to the Applicable Obligor as set forth on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other amount as otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller) </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Bank</I></B>&#148;: as defined in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:11%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">1</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">As per Sept 2021 Assignment and Acknowledgement </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">1 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Benchmark Replacement</I></B>&#148;: as is set forth on <U>Annex A</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Business Day</I></B>&#148;: any day other than a Saturday or Sunday or a legal holiday on which commercial banks are authorized or
required to be closed, or are in fact closed, for business in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (or, if otherwise, the Lending Office of Bank); provided that, when used in connection with an amount that bears interest at a rate based on SOFR or any direct or
indirect calculation or determination of SOFR, the term &#147;Business Day&#148; means any such day that is also a U.S. Government Securities Business Day. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Closing Date</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;6(a) of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Collateral</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;5 hereof. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Collection Account</I></B>&#148;: the account of Seller or Bank, in either case designated as the &#147;Collection Account&#148;
on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other account of Seller or Bank as may be mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Commercial Dispute</I></B>&#148;: Any failure of an Applicable Obligor to make payment in full of a Purchased Receivable due to
(a)&nbsp;any claim, offset, defense, counterclaim, discount, allowance or warranty issue of any kind with respect to a Purchased Receivable or (b)&nbsp;any dispute arising under, from or relating to any Contract or the transactions related thereto
(including any dispute with respect to the applicable Goods or Services, price, terms, quality, workmanship, delivery, quantity and any levies, taxes and duties related to the relevant transaction); provided, neither of the following shall be deemed
a &#147;Commercial Dispute&#148; hereunder (x)&nbsp;a dispute between the Bank, on the one hand, and Seller, on the other hand, with respect to their rights and obligations under this Agreement or (y)&nbsp;any Purchased Receivable otherwise
remaining unpaid due to the Applicable Obligor&#146;s insolvency, creditworthiness or financial well-being. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Contract</I></B>&#148;: with respect to each Purchased Receivable, the applicable contract and/or purchase order between Seller
and the Applicable Obligor pursuant to which Seller has agreed to sell the Goods or provide Services to the Applicable Obligor (and the Applicable Obligor has agreed to acquire the Goods or accept the Services from Seller) on the terms set forth
therein, together with all amendments thereto and related bills of lading or transport documents, invoices and delivery confirmations, if required. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Credit Agreement</I></B>&#148;: shall mean the Second Amended and Restated Credit Agreement dated as of July&nbsp;11, 2013 (as
amended, supplemented and modified from time to time) among the Seller, as borrower, Bank of America, N.A., as joint lead arranger, bookrunner and lender, the several banks and other financial institutions or entities from time to time party
thereto, as lenders, and Castle Pines Capital LLC, as administrative agent and collateral agent. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Credit Protection
Percentage</I></B>&#148;: with respect to each Insured Receivable, the credit protection percentage set forth on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other percentage as otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Credit Support Document</I></B>&#148;: any document evidencing an obligation of a Person other than the Applicable Obligor to make
payment in respect of a Purchased Receivable or to provide property to secure such obligation. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Default Rate</I></B>&#148;:
the percentage per annum set forth on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other percentage as otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller); <U>provided that</U>, with respect to any calculation of interest based on the Default
Rate with respect to the Repurchase Price for any applicable Purchased Receivable, such Default Rate shall be based on the Term SOFR Rate as determined in accordance with the terms of this Agreement for each day for which interest is payable as to
such Repurchase Price. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">2 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Delivered</I></B>&#148;: with respect to the applicable Goods or Services, the
delivery of such Goods to, or performance of such Services for, the Applicable Obligor (or, in the case of export sales, to the applicable third party) in accordance with the applicable Contract, and the fulfillment, completion and satisfaction in
full of all other obligations necessary to give rise to the applicable Receivable under such Contract and any applicable International Commercial Terms (as published by the International Chamber of Commerce). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Designated Persons</I></B>&#148;: a Person (a)&nbsp;listed in the annex to, or otherwise subject to the provisions of, any
Executive Order; (b)&nbsp;named as a &#147;Specially Designated National and Blocked Person&#148; (&#147;<B><I>SDN</I></B>&#148;) on the most current list published by OFAC at its official website or any replacement website or other replacement
official publication of such list (the &#147;<B><I>SDN List</I></B>&#148;) or otherwise the subject of any Sanctions Laws and Regulations; or (c)&nbsp;in which a Person on the SDN List has a 50% or greater ownership interest or that is otherwise
controlled by an SDN. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Discount Amount</I></B>&#148;: with respect to any Purchased Receivable, the amount calculated by
multiplying the product of (a)&nbsp;the Invoice Amount, (b)&nbsp;the Funding Percentage, (c)&nbsp;the Discount Rate and (d)&nbsp;the Tenor divided by 360. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Discount Rate</I></B>&#148;: the rate designated as the &#147;Discount Rate&#148; on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other
rate as otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Dollars</I></B>&#148; or &#147;<B><I>$</I></B>&#148;:
the lawful currency of the United States of America. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Due Date</I></B>&#148;: with respect to each Purchased Receivable, the
due date specified in paragraph 2 of the applicable Purchase Notice. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Early Payment Eligible Receivable</I></B>&#148;: means
any Purchased Receivable with a Maturity Date that is at least sixteen (16)&nbsp;days after the Purchase Date for such Purchased Receivable.<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">2</SUP> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Early Payment Rebate Amount</I></B>&#148;: with respect to any applicable Purchased Receivable, the amount calculated by
multiplying the product of (a)&nbsp;the Invoice Amount, (b)&nbsp;the Funding Percentage, (c)&nbsp;the Discount Rate and (d)&nbsp;the Early Payment Rebate Days divided by 360.<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">3</SUP> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Early Payment Rebate Days</I></B>&#148;: with respect to any Early Payment Eligible Receivable that is paid in full by or on
behalf of the Applicable Obligor prior to the Maturity Date for such Early Payment Eligible Receivable, the number of days from and including the 15<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">th</SUP> day after the Purchase Date for such Early
Payment Eligible Receivable until but not including the date such Early Payment Eligible Receivable is paid in full (for illustrative purposes only, and without limitation (x)&nbsp;if an Early Payment Eligible Receivable has a Maturity Date that is
16 days after its Purchase Date, and is paid in full by or on behalf of the Applicable Obligor on the 15<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">th</SUP> day following the Purchase Date for such Early Payment Eligible Receivable, the number of
Early Payment Rebate Days for such Early Payment Eligible Receivable shall be one (1)&nbsp;day, and (y)&nbsp;if an Early Payment Eligible Receivable has a Maturity Date that is 20 days after its Purchase Date, and is paid in full by or on behalf of
the Applicable Obligor on the 15<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">th</SUP> day following the Purchase Date for such Early Payment Eligible Receivable, the number of Early Payment Rebate Days for such Early Payment Eligible Receivable
shall be five (5)&nbsp;days). <SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">4</SUP> </P> <P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:11%">&nbsp;</P>

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Eligible Obligo</I></B><B>r</B>&#148;: any entity listed in <U>Annex A</U>
hereto or any other entity designated by Seller that Bank, in its sole discretion, may approve as an &#147;Obligor&#148; in writing within thirty (30)&nbsp;days of receipt of a written request from Seller (which written request shall include the
name of the proposed new Obligor, the jurisdiction of organization of the proposed new Obligor, the jurisdiction of its place of business (or chief executive office if it has more than one place of business), the estimated value of goods and
services that Seller will supply or render to the proposed new Obligor in the following twelve (12)&nbsp;months, the payment terms for invoices and any other information reasonably requested by Bank); <U>provided</U>, that in no event shall any
direct or indirect subsidiary, holding company or affiliate of Seller or any government-owned entity be an Eligible Obligor unless specifically approved in writing by Bank. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Event of Default</I></B>&#148;: the occurrence of any one or more of the following events or circumstances: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Seller shall fail to pay any amount when due in accordance with the terms hereof, and such failure continues uncured for three
(3)&nbsp;Business Days after written notice thereof to such Seller from Bank; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) any representation or warranty made or deemed made by
Seller herein or that is contained in any certificate, document or financial or other statement furnished by Seller at any time under or in connection with this Agreement shall prove to have been inaccurate in any material respect on or as of the
date made or deemed made; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) Seller shall (i)&nbsp;default in the observance or performance of any agreement contained in
Section&nbsp;4(c)(v) of this Agreement, clause (c), (d), (g), (h) or (i)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;8 of this Agreement, or Section&nbsp;22 of this Agreement or (ii)&nbsp;default in the observance or performance of any agreement contained in this
Agreement not described in the foregoing clause (a), (b) or (c)(i), and such default shall continue unremedied for a period of five (5)&nbsp;days after notice thereof to Seller from Bank; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) any default shall occur under any indebtedness of Seller, in an amount in excess of the Threshold Amount, or under any indenture,
agreement or other instrument under which the same may be issued, and such default shall continue for a period of time sufficient to allow or permit the acceleration of the maturity of, or any earlier redemption in respect of, any such indebtedness
(whether or not such maturity is in fact accelerated or such early redemption is called), or any such indebtedness shall not be paid when due (whether by demand, lapse of time, acceleration or otherwise); </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e)&nbsp;(i) Seller shall commence any case, proceeding or other action (A)&nbsp;under any existing or future law of any jurisdiction relating
to bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, or relief of debtors, seeking to have an order for relief entered with respect to it, or seeking to adjudicate it a bankrupt or insolvent, or seeking reorganization, arrangement, adjustment, <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">winding-up,</FONT> liquidation, dissolution, composition or other relief with respect to it or its debts, or (B)&nbsp;seeking appointment of a receiver, manager, receiver and manager, trustee, custodian, conservator or
other similar official for it or for all or any substantial part of its assets, or Seller shall make a general assignment for the benefit of its creditors; or (ii)&nbsp;there shall be commenced against Seller any case, proceeding or other action of
a nature referred to in clause (i)&nbsp;above that (A)&nbsp;results in the entry of an order for relief or any such adjudication or appointment or (B)&nbsp;remains undismissed, undischarged or unbonded for a period of forty-five (45)&nbsp;days; or
(iii)&nbsp;there shall be commenced against Seller any case, proceeding or other action seeking issuance of a warrant of attachment, execution, distraint or similar process against all or any substantial part of its assets that results in the entry
of an order for any such relief that shall not have been vacated, discharged, or stayed or bonded pending appeal within forty-five (45)&nbsp;days from the entry thereof; or (iv)&nbsp;Seller shall take any action in furtherance of, or indicating its
consent to, approval of, or acquiescence in, any of the acts set forth in clause (i), (ii), or (iii)&nbsp;above; or (v)&nbsp;Seller shall generally not, or shall be unable to, or shall admit in writing its inability to, pay its debts as they become
due; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(f) one or more judgments or decrees shall be entered against Seller involving in the aggregate a liability (not paid or fully
covered by insurance as to which the relevant insurance company has not denied coverage) in excess of the Threshold Amount, and all such judgments or decrees shall not have been vacated, discharged, satisfied, stayed or bonded pending appeal for a
period of thirty (30)&nbsp;consecutive days from the entry thereof; </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">4 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(g) this Agreement shall cease, for any reason, to be in full force and effect, or Seller
shall so assert; or </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(h) the Seller shall fail to maintain on a consolidated basis a minimum Tangible Net Worth (as such term is defined
in the Credit Agreement) of $200,000,000. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Executive Order</I></B>&#148;: as defined in the definition of the term Sanctions
Laws and Regulations. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Facility Fee</I></B>&#148;: the upfront fee designated as the &#147;Facility Fee&#148; on <U>Annex
A</U> attached hereto. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Funding Percentage</I></B>&#148;: the funding percentage set forth on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto
(or such other percentage as otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Floor</I></B>&#148; means zero
percent (0.00%) </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Fourth Amendment Effective Date</I></B>&#148; means the &#147;Fourth Amendment Effective Date&#148; under the
Fourth Amendment to Master Receivables Purchase Agreement dated as of November&nbsp;6, 2020, between Bank and Seller. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Goods</I></B>&#148;: the goods of a type identified on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other goods as may be mutually
agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Governmental Authority</I></B>&#148;: any government or political subdivision or
any agency, authority, bureau, central bank, commission, department or instrumentality of either, or any court, tribunal, grand jury or arbitrator, in each case whether foreign or domestic (including the European Union or any supranational
regulatory authority). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Grace Period</I></B>&#148;: with respect to each Purchased Receivable, the grace period (consisting of
the number of days following the Due Date during which payment from the Applicable Obligor will be accepted by Bank as though paid on the Due Date) identified on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other period as may be mutually agreed to in
writing by Bank and Seller); <U>provided that</U>, in no event may the Grace Period exceed the Maximum Grace Period.<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">5</SUP> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Indemnified Taxes</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;10 of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Invoice Amount</I></B>&#148;: with respect to each Purchased Receivable, the face value of the invoice (inclusive of the value of
the Goods and any applicable interest, but exclusive of any sales or use tax or VAT and net of any discounts or credits that have been provided by Seller) in respect of the sale of the applicable Goods or provision of Services from Seller to the
Applicable Obligor </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Judgment Currency</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;16 hereof. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Late Payment Rate</I></B>&#148;: the percentage per annum set forth on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other percentage as
otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller); <U>provided that</U>, with respect to any calculation of interest based on the Late Payment Rate for any applicable Purchased Receivable, such Late Payment Rate shall be based on the Term
SOFR Rate as determined in accordance with the terms of this Agreement for each day for which interest is payable as to such Repurchase Price.<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">6</SUP> </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:11%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">5</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">As per Second Amendment, and as further amended as per the Twelfth Amendment </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">6</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">As per the Twelfth Amendment </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">5 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Law</I></B>&#148;: collectively, all international, foreign, Federal, state,
provincial, territorial and local statutes, treaties, rules, guidelines, regulations, ordinances, codes and administrative or judicial precedents or authorities, including the interpretation or administration thereof by any Governmental Authority
charged with the enforcement, interpretation or administration thereof, and all applicable administrative orders, directed duties, requests, licenses, authorizations and permits of, and agreements with, any Governmental Authority, in each case
whether or not having the force of law and, for purposes hereof, including all successors thereto. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Lender</I></B>&#148;:
shall mean a &#147;lender&#148; under the Credit Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Material Adverse Effect</I></B>&#148;: a material adverse effect
on (a)&nbsp;the business, assets, operations or condition, financial or otherwise, of Seller, (b)&nbsp;the ability of Seller to perform any of its obligations hereunder or (c)&nbsp;the validity or enforceability of this Agreement or the Purchase
Documents or the rights of or benefits available to Bank hereunder or thereunder. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Maturity Date</I></B>&#148;: with respect
to each Purchased Receivable, the date determined by adding the Grace Period (if any, as applicable) to the Due Date.<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">7</SUP> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Maximum Facility Amount</I></B>&#148;: as defined in <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Maximum Grace Period</I></B>&#148;: the number of days designated as the &#147;Maximum Grace Period&#148; on <U>Annex A</U>
attached hereto (or otherwise mutually agreed upon in writing by Bank and Seller) as the maximum number of days allowable under any circumstances for any Grace Period as to any Purchased Receivable under this Agreement.<SUP
STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">8</SUP> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Maximum Invoicing Period</I></B>&#148;: the maximum period from the date of
shipment of the applicable Goods or the date of completion of the applicable Services, in either case to the date the applicable invoice is issued for such Goods or Services, as such period is designated as the &#147;Maximum Invoicing Period&#148;
on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other period otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Maximum
Purchase Period</I></B>&#148;: the maximum period from the date the applicable invoice is issued for the applicable shipment of Goods or completion of Services, in either case to the Purchase Date, as such period is designated as the &#147;Maximum
Purchase Period&#148; on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other period otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Maximum Terms of Payment</I></B>&#148;: the maximum period from the date the applicable invoice is issued for the applicable
shipment of Goods or completion of Services, in either case to the Due Date therefor, as such period is designated as the &#147;Maximum Terms of Payment&#148; on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other period otherwise mutually agreed to in
writing by Bank and Seller). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Notice of Assignment and Irrevocable Payment Instruction</I></B>&#148;: a notice to be delivered
by Seller to the Applicable Obligor in accordance with Section&nbsp;4(a), substantially in the form attached as <U>Exhibit E</U> hereto. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Obligation Currency</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;16 hereof. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Obligor</I></B>&#148; means, with respect to any Receivable, the Person that is obligated to make payments in respect of such
Receivable pursuant to the applicable Contract. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>OFAC</I></B>&#148;: as defined in the definition of the term Sanctions Laws
and Regulations. </P> <P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:11%">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">7</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">As per the Twelfth Amendment </P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">8</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">As per the Twelfth Amendment </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">6 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Other Taxes</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;10 of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Participant</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;14(c) of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B>PATRIOT Act</B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;22(a) of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Person</I></B>&#148;: any natural person, corporation, limited liability company, trust, joint venture, association, company,
partnership, Governmental Authority or other entity. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Purchase Date</I></B>&#148;: with respect to any request for the
purchase of a Receivable made hereunder that has been accepted by Bank, the date on which such purchase occurs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Purchase
Documents</I></B>&#148;: with respect to each Purchased Receivable, (a)&nbsp;the Contract, (b)&nbsp;form of Notice of Assignment and Irrevocable Payment Instruction, (c)&nbsp;each Purchase Notice, invoice, promissory note, transport document and
delivery receipt related thereto, (d)&nbsp;any other documents evidencing the Purchased Receivable or the authenticity and binding nature of the relevant signatures of the Applicable Obligor and Seller, (e)&nbsp;any other documents required to
(i)&nbsp;transfer the Purchased Receivable and all rights under any Credit Support Document or (ii)&nbsp;be presented when enforcing or exercising rights to receive payment under the Purchased Receivable or to collect or realize under any Credit
Support Document, (f)&nbsp;any Credit Support Documents and (g)&nbsp;any other document designated by Bank and Seller as an &#147;Other Purchase Document&#148; in paragraph 12 of the Purchase Notice. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Purchase Notice</I></B>&#148;: as defined in the recitals of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Purchase Price</I></B>&#148;: the amount payable by Bank to Seller on the Purchase Date, which amount shall be equal to
(a)&nbsp;the Invoice Amount multiplied by the Funding Percentage, minus (b)&nbsp;the Discount Amount plus the Service Fee, if applicable </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Purchased Receivable</I></B>&#148;: a Receivable acquired by Bank from Seller hereunder; <U>provided</U> that a Receivable (or
portion thereof) purchased hereunder and subsequently repurchased by Seller pursuant to the terms and conditions hereof shall, upon receipt by Bank of the Repurchase Price therefor, cease to be a Purchased Receivable. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Receivable</I></B>&#148;: all of Seller&#146;s right, title and interest to receive or recover payment from the Applicable Obligor
in the applicable Invoice Amount with respect to one or more applicable invoice(s), including all related rights described in Section&nbsp;3. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Receivable Collateral</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;5 hereof. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Release Agreement</I></B>&#148;: a release agreement entered into among Bank, Seller and the applicable secured party, in form and
substance reasonably satisfactory to Bank. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Repurchase Date</I></B>&#148;: the date specified in the Repurchase Notice, which
shall be at least five (5)&nbsp;Business Days after Seller&#146;s receipt of such Repurchase Notice, as the date upon which Seller shall be obligated to repurchase the applicable Purchased Receivable(s). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Repurchase Event</I></B>&#148;: with respect to any Purchased Receivable, the occurrence of any one or more of the following
events or circumstances: (a)&nbsp;a Commercial Dispute arises with respect to such Purchased Receivable and is not resolved prior to the Due Date; (b)&nbsp;Seller reduces the Invoice Amount of any Purchased Receivable, in resolution of a Commercial
Dispute or otherwise without the written consent of Bank, unless Seller has made a payment to Bank, on or before the applicable Due Date, compensating Bank in full for such reduction; (c)&nbsp;any of the representations or warranties made by Seller
in Section&nbsp;7(a) with respect to such Purchased Receivable were untrue or incorrect in any material respect when made; or (d)&nbsp;Seller fails to comply in any material respect with any of its covenants hereunder with respect to such Purchased
Receivable. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">7 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Repurchase Notice</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;9 of this Agreement.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Repurchase Price</I></B>&#148;: as defined in Section&nbsp;9 of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Sanctions Laws and Regulations</I></B>&#148;: (a) any sanctions, prohibitions or requirements imposed by any executive order (an
&#147;<B><I>Executive Order</I></B>&#148;) or by any sanctions program administered by the U.S. Department of the Treasury Office of Foreign Assets Control or by any successor to its functions (&#147;<B><I>OFAC</I></B>&#148;) <SUP
STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">9</SUP> or any sanctions, prohibitions or requirements imposed by any sanctions program administered by the U.S. Department of State, and (b)&nbsp;any sanctions measures imposed by the United Nations
Security Council, the European Union or the United Kingdom. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>SDN</I></B>&#148;: as defined in the definition of the term
Designated Persons. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>SDN List</I></B>&#148;: as defined in the definition of the term Designated Persons. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Seller</I></B>&#148;: as defined in the introductory paragraph of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Seller Account</I></B>&#148;: the account of Seller specified in paragraph 6 of the applicable Purchase Notice. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Service Fee</I></B>&#148;: the fee designated as the &#147;Service Fee&#148; on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Services</I></B>&#148;: the services of a type identified on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other services otherwise
mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>SOFR</I></B>&#148;: for any day, a rate equal to the secured overnight
financing rate as administered by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York (or a successor administrator of the secured overnight financing rate). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>SOFR Floor</I></B>&#148;: zero basis points (0.00%). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Tenor</I></B>&#148;: with respect to any Purchased Receivable, the greater of (x)&nbsp;number of days from and including the
Purchase Date to but excluding the Maturity Date or (y) 15.<SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">10</SUP> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Term SOFR
Administrator</I></B>&#148;: CME Group Benchmark Administration Limited (CBA) (or a successor administrator of the Term SOFR Reference Rate selected by the Bank in its reasonable discretion). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Term SOFR Rate</I></B>&#148;: as of any day, the rate per annum equal to the Term SOFR Reference Rate for a tenor of one month, as
such rate is published by the Term SOFR Administrator on that day. If the Term SOFR Reference Rate for the tenor of one month has not been published or replaced with a Benchmark Replacement by 11:00 a.m. (Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania time) on such day,
then the Term SOFR Reference Rate, for purposes of clause (A)&nbsp;in the preceding sentence, shall be the Term SOFR Reference Rate for such tenor on the first Business Day preceding such day for which such Term SOFR Reference Rate for such tenor
was published in accordance herewith, so long as such first preceding Business Day is not more than three (3)&nbsp;Business Days prior to such day. If the Term SOFR Rate, determined as provided above, would be less than the SOFR Floor, then the Term
SOFR Rate shall be deemed to be the SOFR Floor. The Term SOFR Rate shall be adjusted automatically without notice to Seller on and as of the effective date of any change in the SOFR Reserve Percentage. </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:11%">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">9</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">10</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">As per the Twelfth Amendment </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">8 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Term SOFR Reference Rate</I></B>&#148; shall mean the forward-looking term rate
based on SOFR. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Terms of Payment</I></B>&#148;: the period from the date the applicable invoice is issued for the applicable
shipment of Goods or completion of Services, in either case to the Due Date therefor, as such period is designated as the &#147;Terms of Payment&#148; on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto (or such other period otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by
Bank and Seller). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Threshold Amount</I></B>&#148;: the amount designated as the &#147;Threshold Amount&#148; on <U>Annex A</U>
attached hereto or such other amount otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Triggering
Event</I></B>&#148;: the occurrence of any one or more of the following events or circumstances: (a)&nbsp;a Purchased Receivable remains unpaid by more than the number of days after the Maturity Date specified on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto;
(b)&nbsp;Bank has determined, in its reasonable discretion, that the Applicable Obligor is subject to an insolvency proceeding or is not solvent, or Seller or Bank has received written notice of an imminent insolvency proceeding of such Applicable
Obligor; (c)&nbsp;an Event of Default has occurred and is continuing; or (d)&nbsp;any other &#147;Triggering Event(s)&#148; specified on <U>Annex A</U> attached hereto. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">True-Up</FONT> Default</I></B>&#148; shall mean occurrence of any of the following with respect
to either the Seller or the Bank (i)&nbsp;such Person shall commence any case, proceeding or other action (A)&nbsp;under any existing or future law of any jurisdiction relating to bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, or relief of debtors, seeking
to have an order for relief entered with respect to it, or seeking to adjudicate it a bankrupt or insolvent, or seeking reorganization, arrangement, adjustment, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">winding-up,</FONT> liquidation, dissolution,
composition or other relief with respect to it or its debts, or (B)&nbsp;seeking appointment of a receiver, manager, receiver and manager, trustee, custodian, conservator or other similar official for it or for all or any substantial part of its
assets, or such Person shall make a general assignment for the benefit of its creditors; or (ii)&nbsp;there shall be commenced against such Person any case, proceeding or other action of a nature referred to in clause (i)&nbsp;above that
(A)&nbsp;results in the entry of an order for relief or any such adjudication or appointment or (B)&nbsp;remains undismissed, undischarged or unbonded for a period of forty-five (45)&nbsp;days; or (iii)&nbsp;there shall be commenced against such
Person any case, proceeding or other action seeking issuance of a warrant of attachment, execution, distraint or similar process against all or any substantial part of its assets that results in the entry of an order for any such relief that shall
not have been vacated, discharged, or stayed or bonded pending appeal within forty-five (45)&nbsp;days from the entry thereof; or (iv)&nbsp;such Person shall take any action in furtherance of, or indicating its consent to, approval of, or
acquiescence in, any of the acts set forth in clause (i), (ii), or (iii)&nbsp;above; or (v)&nbsp;such Person shall generally not, or shall be unable to, or shall admit in writing its inability to, pay its debts as they become due. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>UCC</I></B>&#148;: the Uniform Commercial Code as from time to time in effect in the State of New York; <U>provided</U>, that if
by reason of mandatory provisions of applicable Law, the perfection, the effect of perfection or <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-perfection</FONT> or the priority of the security interests of Bank is governed by the Uniform Commercial Code as
in effect in another jurisdiction, the term &#147;UCC&#148; shall mean the Uniform Commercial Code as in effect in such other jurisdiction for purposes of the provisions hereof relating to such perfection, effect of perfection or <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-perfection</FONT> or priority. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>U.S. Government Securities Business Day</I></B>&#148; means any
day except for (a)&nbsp;a Saturday or Sunday or (b)&nbsp;a day on which the Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association recommends that the fixed income departments of its members be closed for the entire day for purposes of trading in
United States government securities. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>VAT</I></B>&#148;: any value-added tax payable in any applicable jurisdiction. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">9 </P>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<B><I>Waiting Period</I></B>&#148;: with respect to any Purchased Receivable that is
not paid in full by or on behalf of the Applicable Obligor on or prior to its Maturity Date, the period from the first Business Day following the Maturity Date through and including the day that is four (4)&nbsp;Business Days following the Maturity
Date (or such other day as may be mutually agreed to in writing by Bank and Seller); <U>provided</U> that if the Applicable Obligor is then subject to any bankruptcy, insolvency or other comparable proceedings, then the Waiting Period shall be
deemed to be zero (0)&nbsp;days and Bank shall be authorized to initiate legal proceedings or otherwise exercise remedies pursuant to Section&nbsp;9(b) immediately upon the occurrence of any applicable Maturity Date.<SUP
STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">11</SUP> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">12</SUP>&#147;<B><I>WeFi
Parties</I></B>&#148;: collectively, (x)&nbsp;WeFi Technology Group LLC, a limited liability company formed under the laws of the State of Delaware (&#147;<B><I>WeFi</I></B>&#148;) and, as more fully described and provided for in the 2021 Assignment
and Agreement, the servicing agent of Bank with respect to this Agreement and the Receivables purchase facility provided for hereunder, and (y)&nbsp;all affiliates, officers, directors, employees, and agents of WeFi. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) <U>Interpretative Provisions</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) As used herein, and any certificate or other document made or delivered pursuant hereto, (i)&nbsp;the word &#147;incur&#148; shall be
construed to mean incur, create, issue, assume, become liable in respect of or suffer to exist (and the words &#147;incurred&#148; and &#147;incurrence&#148; shall have correlative meanings), (ii) the words &#147;asset&#148; and &#147;property&#148;
shall be construed to have the same meaning and effect and to refer to any and all tangible and intangible assets and properties, including cash, capital stock, securities, revenues, accounts, leasehold interests and contract rights,
(iii)&nbsp;references to agreements or other contractual obligations shall, unless otherwise specified, be deemed to refer to such agreements or contractual obligations as amended, supplemented, restated or otherwise modified from time to time and
(iv)&nbsp;the words &#147;include&#148;, &#147;includes&#148; and &#147;including&#148; shall be deemed to be followed by the phrase &#147;without limitation&#148;. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii) The words &#147;hereof,&#148; &#147;herein&#148; and &#147;hereunder&#148; and words of similar import, when used in this Agreement,
shall refer to this Agreement as a whole and not to any particular provision of this Agreement, and Section, Schedule, Annex and Exhibit references are to this Agreement unless otherwise specified. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:9%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(iii) The meanings given to terms defined herein shall be equally applicable to both the singular and plural forms of such terms. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>SECTION 2. <U>Sale of Receivables; Obligation to Offer; Uncommitted Facility</U>. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Each purchase of a Receivable hereunder shall be made as set forth in this Section&nbsp;2(a). Seller shall give Bank an irrevocable
Purchase Notice and, if required by Bank, all other Purchase Documents (which Purchase Notice and other Purchase Documents must be received by Bank prior to 12:00 Noon, Houston, Texas time, on the day that is three (3)&nbsp;Business Days prior to
the anticipated Purchase Date, unless Bank agrees to a shorter notice in its sole discretion) requesting that Bank purchase the Receivables set forth on the Purchase Notice on the terms and conditions set forth in the Purchase Notice. Such Purchase
Notice and other Purchase Documents shall be delivered by <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">e-mail</FONT> transmission unless otherwise mutually agreed in writing by Bank and Seller. If Bank elects, in its sole discretion, to purchase any such
Receivables requested by Seller, Bank shall provide written (including for this purpose by electronic mail) notice thereof to Seller within one (1)&nbsp;Business Day after Bank&#146;s receipt of the applicable Purchase Notice and, upon satisfaction
(or waiver in accordance with Section&nbsp;20) of the conditions precedent to such purchase set forth in Sections 6(a) and 6(b), Bank shall pay or credit to the Seller Account the aggregate Purchase Price in immediately available funds, less any
deduction required to be withheld therefrom to satisfy Seller obligations then due and payable under this Agreement, on the Purchase Date. </P>
<P STYLE="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:11%">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><SUP STYLE="font-size:75%; vertical-align:top">11</SUP>&nbsp;</TD>
